1.text: Find a clean, dry work space.

2.text: Remove any stickers or adhesives from the windows.

3.text: Clean up the windows using soapy water and a 1" razor blade.

4.text: Take a clean rag and dry the window.

5.text: Roll the window back up before beginning, but leave your car on.

6.text: Determine which side of the tint is adhesive.

7.text: Spray the outside of the window with soapy water.

8.text: Place the tinting over the outside of the window so that it covers the entire window.

9.text: Cut away a manageable slab of tinting.

10.text: Spray the front of the film with water.

11.text: Take your knife and cut along the bottom and left edges of the window.

12.text: Pull the film 1" towards the left edge.

13.text: Cut the right edge, then slide the tint halfway back towards the center.

14.text: Pull the film down roughly one inch, so the bottom edge is lower than the window.

15.text: Lower the window a half inch, then use the top of the window to cut the film to shape.

16.text: Clean up any of the corners that have excess film.

17.text: Realign your film so that it fits the window perfectly, with some excess on every edge.

18.text: Working from the top down, use a heat gun and a hard card to push the bubbles to the bottom.

19.text: Prep the inside of the window with soapy water and a squeegee.

20.text: Peel off the top half of the release liner from the tinting film.

21.text: Spray off the now-exposed section with fresh water.

22.text: Line up and adhere the top of the tint to the window.

23.text: Slightly fold the tint to work it underneath the seal.

24.text: Spray down the window again, then use your hard edge to push the water out the edges.

25.text: Roll the window up, then spray the bottom half of the window with soapy water.

26.text: Pull off the remaining release layer, then spray the exposed tint with water.

27.text: Use your fingers and hard edge to tuck the bottom of the tint into the bottom seal.

28.text: Smooth out the window with your hard edge, pushing all the water and air bubbles towards the edges.
